option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# Running from IntelliJ IDEA - Complete Guide
## ✅ Problem Fixed!
Your `pom.xml` was empty - I've recreated it and the project now builds successfully!
## How to Run from IntelliJ IDEA
### Method 1: Run Directly (Easiest)
1. **Open the main class:** - Navigate to: `src/main/java/com/bits/school/equipment/EquipmentLendingApplication.java`
2. **Look for the green play button:** - You'll see a green ▶️ triangle next to the `main` method or class name
3. **Click the green play button** and select: - "Run 'EquipmentLendingApplication.main()'"
4. **Application will start** and you'll see console output
### Method 2: Create Run Configuration (Recommended)
1. **Click "Add Configuration"** (top-right corner of IntelliJ)
2. **Click "+" → Select "Spring Boot"**
3. **Fill in the details:** - **Name:** EquipmentLendingApplication - **Main class:** `com.bits.school.equipment.EquipmentLendingApplication` - **Module:** equipment-lending-service - **JRE:** 17
4. **Click "Apply" then "OK"**
5. **Click the green play button** in the toolbar
### Method 3: Maven Run
1. **Right-click on `pom.xml`** in project view
2. **Select "Run Maven" → "spring-boot:run"**
## IntelliJ IDEA Setup Steps
### Step 1: Import as Maven Project
If you haven't imported the project yet:
1. **File → Open** 2. Select the folder: `SCHOOL-EQUIPMENT-LENDING-PORTAL-API` 3. IntelliJ will detect `pom.xml` and ask "Open as Project" or "Open as Maven Project" 4. Choose **"Open as Maven Project"** 5. Wait for dependencies to download (bottom-right corner shows progress)
### Step 2: Enable Annotation Processing (for Lombok)
1. **File → Settings** (or Ctrl+Alt+S) 2. Navigate to: **Build, Execution, Deployment → Compiler → Annotation Processors** 3. **Check:** "Enable annotation processing" 4. Click **Apply** and **OK**
### Step 3: Set Project SDK
1. **File → Project Structure** (Ctrl+Alt+Shift+S) 2. Under **Project Settings → Project** 3. **Project SDK:** Select JDK 17 (or download if not available) 4. **Project language level:** 17 5. Click **Apply** and **OK**
### Step 4: Reload Maven Project
1. Open **Maven tool window** (View → Tool Windows → Maven) 2. Click the **Reload** button (circular arrows icon) 3. Wait for all dependencies to download
## ✅ What Was Fixed
### Problem: - Your `pom.xml` file was **completely empty** - IntelliJ couldn't recognize it as a Maven project - No dependencies were downloaded
### Solution: - ✅ Recreated `pom.xml` with all Spring Boot dependencies - ✅ Downloaded all Maven dependencies - ✅ Compiled successfully (31 source files) - ✅ Created run configuration file
## Expected Console Output When Running
When you run the application, you should see:
``` . ____ _ __ _ _ /\\ / ___'_ __ _ _(_)_ __ __ _ \ \ \ \ ( ( )\___ | '_ | '_| | '_ \/ _` | \ \ \ \ \\/ ___)| |_)| | | | | || (_| | ) ) ) ) ' |____| .__|_| |_|_| |_\__, | / / / / =========|_|==============|___/=/_/_/_/ :: Spring Boot :: (v2.7.0)
2025-11-01 23:13:45.123 INFO ... : Starting EquipmentLendingApplication 2025-11-01 23:13:45.456 INFO ... : HikariPool-1 - Start completed. 2025-11-01 23:13:46.789 INFO ... : Started EquipmentLendingApplication in 2.345 seconds ```
**Look for these success indicators:** - ✅ "HikariPool-1 - Start completed" (Database connected) - ✅ "Started EquipmentLendingApplication" (App is running) - ✅ No red error messages
## Test After Running
Open a new terminal/command prompt and test:
```cmd curl -X POST http://localhost:8083/equipment-service/api/auth/login -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d "{\"email\":\"admin@school.com\",\"password\":\"admin123\"}" ```
**Expected response:** ```json { "token": "TOKEN-abc123...", "userId": 1, "name": "Admin User", "email": "admin@school.com", "role": "ADMIN" } ```
## Troubleshooting
### Issue: "Cannot resolve symbol 'SpringBootApplication'" **Solution:** 1. Right-click on project → Maven → Reload Project 2. File → Invalidate Caches → Invalidate and Restart
### Issue: "Lombok annotations not working" **Solution:** 1. Install Lombok plugin: File → Settings → Plugins → Search "Lombok" → Install 2. Enable annotation processing (see Step 2 above) 3. Restart IntelliJ
### Issue: "Port 8083 already in use" **Solution:** 1. Stop any other running application on port 8083 2. Or change port in `application.yml`: `server.port: 8084`
### Issue: "Cannot connect to database" **Solution:** 1. Make sure MySQL is running 2. Check credentials in `application.yml`: ```yaml username: root password: postgres ``` 3. Verify database exists: `SHOW DATABASES;` in MySQL
## Project Structure in IntelliJ
After setup, you should see:
``` equipment-lending-service ├── src/main/java │ └── com.bits.school.equipment │ ├── controller (AuthController, EquipmentController, BorrowController) │ ├── service (interfaces) │ ├── service.impl (implementations) │ ├── dao (interfaces) │ ├── dao.impl (implementations) │ ├── repository (Spring Data JPA) │ ├── entity (User, Equipment, BorrowRequest) │ ├── dto (request/response objects) │ ├── util (AuthUtil) │ └── EquipmentLendingApplication.java ← Main class ├── src/main/resources │ └── application.yml ← Database config ├── pom.xml ← Maven dependencies └── target ← Compiled files ```
## Quick Commands
### Rebuild Project: **Build → Rebuild Project** (Ctrl+Shift+F9)
### Clean and Build: **Right-click pom.xml → Run Maven → clean install**
### Stop Application: **Red square button** in Run tool window (or Ctrl+F2)
### View Logs: **Run tool window** at the bottom (Alt+4)
## ✅ You're All Set!
Your project is now properly configured to run from IntelliJ IDEA. Just click the green play button and start testing your Auth API!
